A futuristic underwater city, called "Aquaria", is being threatened by a group of rogue robots that have been secretly built by a former scientist. The scientist, who has since gone mad, has programmed the robots to destroy the city and its inhabitants. The main character, a skilled engineer and inventor, must navigate the treacherous underwater terrain and outsmart the robots to save the city.

In a world where memories can be implanted, edited, and even stolen, a young woman discovers that she has the ability to see through the fabricated memories of those around her. She uses this power to uncover a conspiracy involving a powerful corporation that has been manipulating people's memories for their own gain. As she delves deeper into the mystery, she must confront her own troubled past and the true nature of her ability.

In a post-apocalyptic world where the sun has been extinguished, a group of survivors must band together to uncover the cause of the catastrophe and find a way to restore the sun. Along the way, they discover that the sun's disappearance is linked to an ancient technology that has been hidden beneath the earth for centuries. The technology, known as the "Echo," holds the key to restoring the sun, but it also poses a great danger to humanity.

In a world where dreams are a parallel reality, a young man discovers that he has the ability to enter people's dreams and manipulate their subconscious thoughts. He uses this power to help people overcome their fears and anxieties, but soon finds himself trapped in a never-ending cycle of lucid dreaming. As he tries to escape the dream world, he must confront the dark forces that are manipulating the dreams of others.

In a world where time is currency, the rich can live forever and the poor are left with nothing but the fleeting moments of their lives. A young thief, who has the ability to steal time from the wealthy, must navigate the complex web of time traders and corrupt officials to uncover the truth behind the time trade. Along the way, he discovers that his actions have unintended consequences on the fabric of time itself.
